result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Lee Heard

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant James Lee Heard not in court, in custody.  Stephan Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      
Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing.Defense counsel request an adjournment for reasons stated on the record. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant James Lee Heard not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant James Lee Heard not in court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Parties requested an adjournment. Court grants parties request. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James Lee Heard in court by video with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland who appears in person.  Defendant James Lee Heard in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer L. Rom.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed

Defendant James Lee Heard not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY of the named or initaled victims or witnessesin the complaint.

Defendant James Lee Heard in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant James Lee Heard in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Lee Heard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Motion to dismiss by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3, 5, 6.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
